Dear Ms. Marry:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
November 15, 2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written
corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date
of this letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 899-6024 .
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
(5) An agency shall involve the child’s parent or parents
and the foster parents in the development of service
plans to enable the parent or parents and foster parents
to understand the plan for the child and the parents’ and
the foster parent’s role in assisting the agency in carrying
out the plan. An agency shall give a copy to and review
the parent-agency treatment plan with the parent or
parents and foster parents. The agency must inform the
parent or parents and foster parent that the information in
the parent-agency treatment plan and any other
information about the child and the child’s family is
confidential.
One of twenty-one treatment plans did not have documentation to indicate a copy
was provided to the parents.
CPA Rule 400.12405 Change of placement
(3) The agency shall document all the following in the
child’s record before a change of placement occurs:
(i) That the current foster parent was notified in writing of
the following information: (i) Not less than 14 calendar
days in advance, of the change, except when prior
notification would jeopardize the child’s care or safety. If
prior notice is not provided, then the agency shall notify
the foster parent, at the time of the change, why prior
2

notice was not given. (ii) Of the current foster parent’s
rights concerning the change in placement.
One of six foster care files did not have documentation the foster parent was notified
of the items required by this rule. These items are typically documented on a DHHS-
30 form.
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
(2) Only in an after-hours emergency placement will a
verbal agreement be acceptable. During an after-hours
emergency placement, the certifying agency must
provide a verbal summary of the information in subrule
(1)(a) to (h) of this rule to the borrowing agency. Written
borrowed home protocol must be completed and
documented within 3 calendar days of an after-hours
emergency placement.
One of three borrowed bed files had a verbal agreement documented but did not
have the required documentation for the (g) foster parent agency agreement or (b)
placement agreement signed within three calendar days.
CPA Rule 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation
(1) An agency social service worker shall complete a
written adoptive evaluation within 90 days of the
family signing an adoption application and prior to
approving a family for adoption.
Two of two adoption family assessments were not completed within 90 days.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
11/29/22 RENEWAL, CAP approved 12/16/22.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following area:
o Medical Passports: Per clarification from the DHHS policy/contract office,
Medical Passports must be generated and saved in MiSACWIS quarterly
for every foster care youth. Regardless of whether signatures are required
by parents or foster parents.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation.
3

VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during
this licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. CAP
approved 12/16/22 was a result of the 11/29/22 renewal evaluation. During the
2022 review eight rule and contract violations were found. The agency reported
successful implementation of their CAP. During the current review only four
violations were found. One violation was a repeat from the 2022 review. The
violation was regarding timely completion of adoption family assessments.
Overall, the agency has shown significant improvement in several areas.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed and discussed. The agency
reported successful implementation of their 2022 CAP. The agency identified the
following issues that have impacted ongoing compliance: adoption evaluation
timeliness due to applicants not being timely, family team meetings not occurring
due to a lack of parental engagement, and difficulty completing licensing 3130a
evaluations as staff have many additional responsibilities with the increase of
relative placements. The agency has identified a thorough plan to continue to
address these areas.
Financial Overview
No financial concerns were found.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Two staff were interviewed on-site. Both staff reported they enjoy being with the
agency. The administrative team is supportive and knowledgeable, and staff work
well together. Staff reported systemic issues that make their jobs difficult at times.
However, there were no concerns or suggestions for improvement for the agency.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency continues to be located in the same building as the 2022 review. The
office is located in downtown Adrian, MI. There is sufficient space for staff and
clients. There is adequate locking storage for confidential information.
4

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
